docs.lead_paragraph: A VOTER had to listen closely (and tune out Vice President Al Gore's aria of sighs) to hear it, but there was something off-kilter about Gov. George W. Bush's references to Democrats during the debate on Tuesday night, something off-key in his tone. He sounded as if he liked them.

headline.main: The Nation: Make Way for The Donkephant; The Bare-Knuckled Business of Bipartisanship

docs.abstract: George W Bush's performance in presidential debate reviewed; his appeals for bipartisanship reflect polls showing that Americans are wearing of bickering and gridlock in government; drawings of new political creature called the donkephant (M)
docs.snippet: A VOTER had to listen closely (and tune out Vice President Al Gore's aria of sighs) to hear it, but there was something off-kilter about Gov. George W. Bush's references to Democrats during the debate on Tuesday night, something off-key in his tone. ...

docs.lead_paragraph: Laura Margaret Moffatt and Edmond F. Thompson are to be married today at St. Patrick's Church in Huntington, N.Y. The Rev. John J. Denniston, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony. The bride, 36, is the director of public relations at Mary McFadden Couture in New York. She graduated from Marymount College of Virginia.
docs.snippet: Laura Margaret Moffatt and Edmond F. Thompson are to be married today at St. Patrick's Church in Huntington, N.Y. The Rev. John J. Denniston, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony.    The bride, 36, is the director of public relations...

docs.lead_paragraph: THEY work side by side every day in the high-pressure world of hospital operating rooms -- sedating patients, seeing them safely through intrusive medical procedures and easing their pain. But in the political arena, they are at each other's throats. Two interrelated medical professions -- physician anesthesiologists and nurse anesthetists -- are locked in a turf war over who may do what, in what setting, under whose supervision and for what pay.

headline.main: Personal Business; In This Doctor-vs.-Nurse Debate, Long, Deep Breaths

docs.abstract: Interrelated medical professions--physician anesthesiologists and nurse anesthetists--are locked in turf war over who may do what, in what setting, under whose supervision and for what pay; fight has been brewing since 1997, when Health Care Finance Administration, agency that decides what Medicare will and will not pay for, first proposed lifting federal rule requiring nurse anethetists be supervised by physician; proposal has been approved by Health and Human Services Sec Donna Shalala and awaits final administrative clearance, from Office of Management and Budget, before taking effect; argument is over whether shift would affect quality; photo (M)
